metadata.title: CVE-2023-2177 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference issue was found in the sctp network protocol innet/sctp/stream_sched.c in Linux Kernel. If stream_in allocation is failed,stream_out is freed which would further be accessed. A local user could usethis flaw to crash the system or potentially cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-128-lowlatency - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-lowlatency - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1086-aws - 5.4.0-1086.93~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1094-azure - 5.4.0-1094.100~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1092-gcp - 5.4.0-1092.101~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1034-ibm - 5.4.0-1034.38~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1084-oracle - 5.4.0-1084.92~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1071-raspi - 5.4.0-1071.81~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
